PURPOSE
The purpose of this procedure is to provide a standard for compliance across the PeaceHealth system for the use and storage of the PeaceHealth Confidentiality Agreements.
DEFINITIONS
•
Confidential PeaceHealth Information: Information related to patients, caregivers, providers, financial data, and /or any other information pertaining to PeaceHealth business or proprietary information is to be considered strictly confidential unless specified otherwise.
•
PeaceHealth Information: Information related to patients, caregivers, providers, financial data, and /or any other information pertaining to PeaceHealth business or proprietary information is to be considered strictly confidential unless specified otherwise.
•
Third Party: Any person or group performing work including but not limited to technical support, maintenance, implementation or any other services performed on behalf of PeaceHealth (e.g. vendor, contracted client, sales and support, manufacturer, distributor, etc.).
PROCEDURE
This procedure implements Confidentiality, Security and Privacy of PeaceHealth Information Policy .
The Confidentiality Agreement is used to confirm that an individual agrees to maintain the confidentiality, security, and privacy of PeaceHealth information related to patients, providers, caregivers, and PeaceHealth business. Individuals who have access to PeaceHealth confidential information resources are required to renew their Confidentiality Agreements annually or risk loss of access to those resources.
1. Signatures and annual renewal:
a.
Initial signature on the Confidentiality Agreement is obtained on paper.
b.
Annual Confidentiality Agreement renewals are performed electronically unless the individual does not have access to Crossroads or the Internet. Individuals without access to Crossroads or the Internet may renew their Confidentiality Agreements on paper by working with the Network Privacy Officer.
i.
To renew a Confidentiality Agreement using a PeaceHealth computer at a PeaceHealth facility, Open Crossroads, go to http
://apps/security/ConfidentialityAgreement.
aspx , and follow the directions. An e-mail receipt is sent to the user when an agreement is successfully renewed.
ii.
To renew an agreement from outside a PeaceHealth facility, using a non-PeaceHealth device, go to https
://www.peacehealth.org/apps/usersecurity/Default.
aspx and follow the directions.
2. Storage and Documentation:
a.
Human Resources (HR) caregivers scan initial Confidentiality Agreements signed by new PeaceHealth caregivers into their electronic caregiver file. HR caregivers document receipt of the confidentiality agreement by entering in the electronic caregiver file a "PHCA Skill" with the date the agreement was signed as the "Begin Date."
b.
Confidentiality Agreements from third parties received as part of a set-up package for a new user of PeaceHealth information systems are routed to the Information Services and Technology Security Operations Department. Agreements are scanned and stored electronically in the department's secure network shared drive. Receipt of the agreement is documented in the "Level 1" user database by the Security Compliance Analyst who builds the Level 1 record.
i.
Third parties who have access to PeaceHealth confidential information resources are required to renew their Confidentiality Agreements annually or risk loss of access to those resources.
ii.
Confidentiality Agreements signed by third parties are scanned into Meditract.
HELP
Further guidance concerning this procedure may be obtain from the Network privacy officer.
